intro: Beilia spicata var. brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved beilia, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, blooming in early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, with a compact growth habit that makes it suitable for rock gardens or borders. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a versatile addition to many gardens.
